001package de.mnl.osgi.slf4j2osgi.test;
002
003import de.mnl.osgi.coreutils.ServiceCollector;
004import java.util.Collections;
005import java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch;
006import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
007import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean;
008import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertEquals;
009import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertNotNull;
010import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertTrue;
011import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
012import org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.ExtendWith;
013import org.mockito.junit.jupiter.MockitoExtension;
014import org.osgi.framework.Bundle;
015import org.osgi.framework.BundleContext;
016import org.osgi.framework.BundleException;
017import org.osgi.framework.FrameworkUtil;
018import org.osgi.service.log.LogEntry;
019import org.osgi.service.log.LogLevel;
020import org.osgi.service.log.LogListener;
021import org.osgi.service.log.LogReaderService;
022import org.slf4j.Logger;
023import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
024
025@ExtendWith(MockitoExtension.class)
026public class LoggerCallTest {
027
028    protected static final Logger logger
029        = LoggerFactory.getLogger("Logger Call Test");
030    protected static final Logger classLogger
031        = LoggerFactory.getLogger(LoggerCallTest.class);
032
033    private final BundleContext context = FrameworkUtil
034        .getBundle(LoggerCallTest.class).getBundleContext();
035
036    @Test
037    public void testBasicUsage() throws InterruptedException {
038        AtomicBoolean gotIt = new AtomicBoolean();
039        try (ServiceCollector<LogReaderService,
040                LogReaderService> logReaderProvider
041                    = new ServiceCollector<>(context, LogReaderService.class)) {
042            logReaderProvider.open();
043            LogReaderService logReader
044                = logReaderProvider.waitForService(1000).get();
045            CountDownLatch latch = new CountDownLatch(1);
046            logReader.addLogListener(new LogListener() {
047                @Override
048                public void logged(LogEntry entry) {
049                    if (entry.getMessage()
050                        .startsWith("Calling Logger from Test.")) {
051                        assertEquals("de.mnl.osgi.slf4j2osgi.test",
052                            entry.getBundle().getSymbolicName());
053                        gotIt.set(true);
054                        latch.countDown();
055                    }
056                }
057            });
058            classLogger.info("Calling Logger from {}.", "Test");
059            latch.await(1000, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
060            assertTrue(gotIt.get());
061        }
062    }
063
064    @Test
065    public void testClassUsage() throws InterruptedException {
066        AtomicBoolean gotIt = new AtomicBoolean();
067        try (ServiceCollector<LogReaderService,
068                LogReaderService> logReaderProvider
069                    = new ServiceCollector<>(context, LogReaderService.class)) {
070            logReaderProvider.open();
071            LogReaderService logReader
072                = logReaderProvider.waitForService(1000).get();
073            CountDownLatch latch = new CountDownLatch(1);
074            logReader.addLogListener(new LogListener() {
075                @Override
076                public void logged(LogEntry entry) {
077                    if (entry.getMessage()
078                        .startsWith("Calling Logger from Test.")) {
079                        assertEquals("de.mnl.osgi.slf4j2osgi.test",
080                            entry.getBundle().getSymbolicName());
081                        gotIt.set(true);
082                        latch.countDown();
083                    }
084                }
085            });
086            logger.info("Calling Logger from {}.", "Test");
087            latch.await(1000, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
088            assertTrue(gotIt.get());
089        }
090    }
091
092    @Test
093    public void testBuffered() throws InterruptedException, BundleException {
094        Bundle osgiLoggerFactory = context.getServiceReference(
095            org.osgi.service.log.LoggerFactory.class).getBundle();
096        assertNotNull(osgiLoggerFactory);
097        try {
098            osgiLoggerFactory.stop();
099            logger.info("Calling Logger {}", "Info");
100            logger.warn("Calling Logger Warn");
101            logger.error("Calling Logger Error", new Throwable());
102            osgiLoggerFactory.start();
103            try (ServiceCollector<LogReaderService,
104                    LogReaderService> logReaderProvider
105                        = new ServiceCollector<>(context,
106                            LogReaderService.class)) {
107                logReaderProvider.open();
108                LogReaderService logReader
109                    = logReaderProvider.waitForService(1000).get();
110                CountDownLatch latch = new CountDownLatch(3);
111                for (LogEntry entry : Collections.list(logReader.getLog())) {
112                    if (entry.getMessage().startsWith("Calling Logger Info")
113                        && entry.getLogLevel() == LogLevel.INFO) {
114                        latch.countDown();
115                    }
116                    if (entry.getMessage().startsWith("Calling Logger Warn")
117                        && entry.getLogLevel() == LogLevel.WARN) {
118                        latch.countDown();
119                    }
120                    if (entry.getMessage().startsWith("Calling Logger Error")
121                        && entry.getLogLevel() == LogLevel.ERROR
122                        && entry.getException() != null) {
123                        latch.countDown();
124                    }
125                }
126                latch.await(1000, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
127                assertEquals(0, latch.getCount());
128            }
129        } finally {
130            osgiLoggerFactory.start();
131        }
132    }
133
134    /*
135     * (Too) basic.
136     */
137    @Test
138    public void testLoggerCache() throws InterruptedException, BundleException {
139        Logger logger1 = LoggerFactory.getLogger("Test");
140        Logger logger2 = LoggerFactory.getLogger("Test");
141        assertTrue(logger1 == logger2);
142    }
143}
